title: General McChrystal

content: "McChrystal kills people. Has he ever worked in the counterinsurgency environment? Not really," said Roger Carstens, a senior nonresident fellow at the Center for a New American Security and a former Special Forces officer. "People will ask, what message are we sending when our high-value-target hunter is sent to lead in Afghanistan?" said a senior military officer at the Pentagon, who spoke on the condition of anonymity because he was not authorized to speak publicly. But McChrystal's demonstrated drive and intellect, as well as his abilities in team-building and problem-solving, have won him many admirers. "Without a doubt, Lieutenant General McChrystal is one of the five best generals in the Army today. He is the perfect man for the job and will be Afghanistan's Petraeus, if anyone can be," said an Army general who served in Iraq with him. He too spoke on the condition of anonymity because he was not authorized to speak publicly. Never met the man, know very little about him, but he sounds like the right man for the job. "McChrystal kills people". This in my opinion was a stupid quote. Is this not a war? Is that not what we as service members and we as veterans were trained to do in the service of our country? I'm not exactly a right-wing extremist but damn...stupid is stupid. If that person has some other reason for objecting to this assignment beyond him being damn good at what he does, I'll listen. If that's it, he's a warrior and we don't want a warrior to lead our warriors...damn, get a clue.
